intro: Barbarea barbareae, commonly known as the mountain rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture. Barbarea barbareae is generally a short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
